review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key2: Since this chapter covered many different functions, here is a quick summary reference:
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key3: moveTo(x, y). Moves the mouse cursor to the given x and y coordinates.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key4: moveRel(xOffset, yOffset). Moves the mouse cursor relative to its current position.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key5: dragTo(x, y). Moves the mouse cursor while the left button is held down.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key6: dragRel(xOffset, yOffset). Moves the mouse cursor relative to its current position while the left button is held down.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key7: click(x, y, button). Simulates a click (left button by default).
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key10: doubleClick(). Simulates a double left-button click.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key11: mouseDown(x, y, button). Simulates pressing down the given button at the position x, y.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key12: mouseUp(x, y, button). Simulates releasing the given button at the position x, y.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key13: scroll(units). Simulates the scroll wheel. A positive argument scrolls up; a negative argument scrolls down.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key14: typewrite(message). Types the characters in the given message string.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key15: typewrite([key1, key2, key3]). Types the given keyboard key strings.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key16: press(key). Presses the given keyboard key string.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key17: keyDown(key). Simulates pressing down the given keyboard key.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key18: keyUp(key). Simulates releasing the given keyboard key.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key19: hotkey([key1, key2, key3]). Simulates pressing the given keyboard key strings down in order and then releasing them in reverse order.
review-of-the-pyautogui-functions_key20: screenshot(). Returns a screenshot as an Image object. (See Chapter 17 for information on Image objects.)
